Class Theater

  • java.lang.Object
    • Theater

  • public class Theater
extends java.lang.Object
    Theater where all customers enter in order to purchase tickets. The theater contains a list of all customers present, auditoriums, and three queues. Customers enter the shortest queue available to them and enter the theater once they purchase their tickets.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Theater

        public Theater(double ticketPrice)
        Constructor for a Theater. Creates a theater with an empty collection of auditoriums, an empty collection of customers, and an empty collection of customer lines.

        By default, the customer line to be served first is set to -1. This must be set to a value greater or equal to 0 and less than the total number of lines before the theater will function properly.

        The price for one theater ticket, regardless of movie being seen, is the value passed as an argument.

        Parameters:
        ticketPrice - the price of one ticket.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfMovies

        public int getNumberOfMovies()
        Returns the total number of auditoriums in the theater. This number is equal to the total number of movies currently playing in this theater.
        Returns:
        the total number of auditoriums.

      • enqueueCustomer

        public Line enqueueCustomer(Customer customer,
                            boolean hasChild)
        Enqueues a customer in the shortest line available to them. This method is the only way to add customers to this theater. From the time they enter a line to the time they leave, a customer with a name matching the name of the given customer may not enter the theater.

        The given customer may enter the express line only if hasChild is true. A customer bound for the express line will be put in a regular line instead if a regular line is atleast twice as short as the express line. Out of the regular lines, the customer will be put in the shortest one.

        Returns the line into which the customer was placed.

        Parameters:
        customer - the customer to be enqueued.
        hasChild - if true, the customer may be put in the express line.
        Returns:
        the line into which the customer was placed.

      • containsCustomer

        public boolean containsCustomer(java.lang.String name)
        Returns true if a customer with a name matching the given name is currently in the theater's lines or auditoriums.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the customer who is in the theater or not.
        Returns:
        true if a customer with the given name is in the theater.

      • hasEnoughSeats

        public boolean hasEnoughSeats(java.lang.String movie,
                              int partySize)
        Returns true if the auditorium playing the given movie has a number of empty seats that is greater or equal to the given party size.
        Parameters:
        movie - the movie for which to check seat count.
        partySize - the size of the customer party to find seating for.
        Returns:
        true if there are enough seats.

      • findFirstAvailableMovie

        public java.lang.String findFirstAvailableMovie(int partySize)
        Finds the first auditorium that has enough empty seats to accommodate the given party size. The auditoriums are searched by the title of the movie they are playing. The movies are in ascending alphabetical order. Returns the name of the movie that can be seen by the entire viewing party. If all movies are sold out, an empty String is returned.
        Parameters:
        partySize - the party size to find seating for.
        Returns:
        the name of the movie, or an empty String if all movies sold out.

      • getNextCustomer

        public Customer getNextCustomer()
        Returns the customer that is next up to be served. If the line to served is empty, the next-line index is advanced until it comes back to the current line or it finds a customer. Note that this method only returns the customer reference. It does not remove the customer from the theater line.
        Returns:
        the next customer to be served.

      • seatNextCustomer

        public Customer seatNextCustomer()
        Dequeues the next customer in the current line and seats them in their desired auditorium. Assumes this auditorium will have enough empty seats to accommodate the entire customer party.
        Returns:
        the customer that has been served.

      • getLineInfo

        public java.lang.String getLineInfo(int lineIndex)
        Returns the string representation of the line at the given index.
        Parameters:
        lineIndex - the index of line to get the String representation of.
        Returns:
        String representation of the line at the given index.

      • removeFromLine

        public void removeFromLine()
        Removes the next customer to be served from the theater. All records of this customer are removed from the theater. They leave without purchasing any tickets. The next-line index is advanced following this call.

      • removeFromTheater

        public void removeFromTheater(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a customer and all members of their party from the theater. The customer party matching the given name is removed from whichever auditorium they were watching their movie in.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the customer party to remove.

      • getNumberOfTicketsSold

        public int getNumberOfTicketsSold(java.lang.String movie)
        Returns the total number of tickets sold for the given movie.
        Parameters:
        movie - the movie for which to get the number of tickets sold.
        Returns:
        the number of tickets sold.

      • getTicketSales

        public double getTicketSales()
        Each auditorium keeps count of its individual ticket sales. Each auditorium's sales are printed out along with a grand total.
        Returns:
        total Total sales made so far.

      • addAuditorium

        public void addAuditorium(Auditorium auditorium)
        Adds a new auditorium for a movie to be played in.
        Parameters:
        auditorium - the auditorium to be added to the theater list.

      • removeAuditorium

        public void removeAuditorium(java.lang.String movie)
        Removes an existing auditorium from this theater. The auditorium removed will be the one that is playing the given movie.
        Parameters:
        movie - the auditorium playing this movie will be removed.

      • addLine

        public void addLine(java.lang.String lineName)
        Add a customer line to the theater. The line's name will be the given name.
        Parameters:
        lineName - the name of the new line to add to the theater.

      • allLinesEmpty

        public boolean allLinesEmpty()
        Checks each line to see if they are all empty.
        Returns:
        true if all customer lines are empty.

      • allMoviesEmpty

        public boolean allMoviesEmpty()
        Checks each auditorium to see if they are all empty.
        Returns:
        true if all auditoriums are empty.

      • getSeatingChart

        public java.lang.String getSeatingChart(java.lang.String movie)
        Returns the seating chart of the auditorium playing the given movie. The seating chart is returned as a formatted String displaying information about each seat in the auditorium. The seats are numbered by their position in the rows of seats.
        Parameters:
        movie - the movie indicating which Auditorium to get seating chart for
        Returns:
        the given movie's auditorium's seating chart.
